meanings.definition: To expose (a photographic film or plate) to light for too short a time or to light that is insufficient for proper development.
meanings.sent1: The photographer ended up underexposing the film, resulting in dark and blurry pictures.
meanings.sent2: Make sure you don't underexpose the film, or the photos will turn out too dark.
meanings.sent3: The film was so underexposed that the pictures came out looking like they were taken at night!
meanings.sent4: Her artistic choice to underexpose the film created a mysterious and moody atmosphere in the photos.
meanings.sent5: Underexposing the film gave the images a dramatic and shadowy quality.

meanings.definition: To expose (someone or something) to insufficient light or inadequate exposure.
meanings.sent1: The plant suffered from underexposing to sunlight, causing it to wilt.
meanings.sent2: Avoid underexposing your skin to the sun to prevent sunburn.
meanings.sent3: The room was so underexposed to light that it felt like a cave during the day!
meanings.sent4: Underexposing the painting with dim lighting added an air of mystery to the artwork.
meanings.sent5: She regretted underexposing the room, as it made it difficult to see anything clearly.
